channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The soldier who died in Cybertruck explosion wrote it was intended as a 'wakeup call'
item.description: Matthew Livelsberger, a 37-year-old Green Beret from Colorado, also wrote in a note that he needed to "cleanse my mind" of the lives lost of people he...

item.title: 1/3: CBS Evening News
item.description: Feds find bomb-making material in home of New Orleans attacker; Louisiana boy rewarded after giving away his only dollar

item.title: Net neutrality is struck, ending a long battle to regulate ISPs like public utilities
item.description: A U.S. Court of Appeals this week ruled that the FCC did not have legal authority to revive the so-called net neutrality rules that were first introdu...

item.title: Briton among dead in New Orleans vehicle attack
item.description: The family of London man Edward Pettifer mourn a "wonderful son, brother, grandson, nephew and friend".

item.title: Bringing a tyrannical Ethiopian queen and her twins to life
item.description: A compelling new audio drama shines a spotlight on Ethiopia's ancient Aksumite Empire.

item.title: Nassau County flags not lowered to half-staff following Jimmy Carter's death
item.description: A Republican county official on Long Island is refusing to lower flags to half-staff following the death of former President Jimmy Carter.

item.title: Over 100 killed in Gaza Strip in first 3 days of 2025, Hamas-run Health Ministry says

item.title: Trump will be sentenced Jan. 10 in New York case, days before his inauguration
item.description: In a decision Friday, New York Judge Juan Merchan noted that his inclination was to not impose a sentence of incarceration.

item.title: Biden made diversifying the federal bench a top priority. Here's a look at his legacy

item.title: The victims of the deadly New Orleans truck attack
579 animals killed after fire rips through Northwest Dallas shopping center
item.description: Most of the animals died of smoke inhalation, officials said. They included birds, chickens, hamsters, dogs and cats.

item.title: Trump to be sentenced over hush money case but judge signals no jail time
item.description: The US president-elect dismisses the case as "nothing but a rigged charade".

item.title: Venus and crescent Moon stun stargazers
item.description: The planet appeared shining brightly above a crescent Moon on Friday.

item.title: Biden blocks Japan's Nippon Steel from buying US Steel
item.description: Biden decided to scrap the deal despite concerns that it could damage Washington's relations with Tokyo.

item.title: New Orleans attacker had suspected bomb materials at home, reserved truck weeks ago, officials say

item.title: An Army veteran’s path to radicalization followed divorces and struggling businesses in Texas
